storyTitle: As Administrator, I want to perform employee schedule management to achieve optimal staffing.

functional.title: Verify successful employee assignment to shift using template
preconditions: User is logged in with Administrator role and has schedule management permissions
Employee schedule management page is accessible at /admin/schedules
At least one shift template exists in the system (e.g., 'Morning Shift 8AM-4PM')
At least 3 active employees exist in the system with available status
Database EmployeeSchedules table is accessible and operational

steps.action: Navigate to the employee schedule management page by clicking 'Schedules' in the main navigation menu
steps.expectedResult: Employee schedule management interface loads successfully displaying calendar view, shift templates dropdown, and employee list panel

steps.action: Click on the 'Shift Templates' dropdown and select 'Morning Shift 8AM-4PM' template for Monday, January 15, 2024
steps.expectedResult: Selected shift template is highlighted in blue, shift details (time, duration, required staff count) are displayed in the right panel

steps.action: From the available employees list, drag and drop 'John Smith' onto the selected shift slot in the calendar
steps.expectedResult: Employee 'John Smith' appears in the shift slot with employee badge, shift time displays as '8:00 AM - 4:00 PM', no error messages appear

steps.action: Click the 'Save Schedule' button located at the top-right corner of the page
steps.expectedResult: Green success banner appears at top of page with message 'Schedule updated successfully', calendar refreshes showing saved assignment, loading spinner disappears

steps.action: Verify the assignment by refreshing the page and navigating to Monday, January 15, 2024
steps.expectedResult: Previously saved assignment for 'John Smith' in Morning Shift 8AM-4PM is still displayed correctly, data persists after page reload

postconditions: Employee 'John Smith' is assigned to Morning Shift on January 15, 2024 in EmployeeSchedules table
Administrator remains on the schedule management page with calendar view active
Assignment is visible to the employee 'John Smith' in their personal schedule view
Audit log records the schedule assignment with timestamp and administrator username

functional.title: Verify calendar format displays schedules correctly for weekly view
preconditions: User is logged in as Administrator with valid session token
At least 10 employee shift assignments exist across different days of the current week
Employee schedule management page is loaded at /admin/schedules
Browser viewport is set to minimum 1024x768 resolution

steps.action: On the employee schedule management page, click the 'Week View' button in the calendar controls toolbar
steps.expectedResult: Calendar switches to weekly view showing 7 columns (Monday-Sunday) with time slots in rows, current week is highlighted

steps.action: Observe the display of all assigned shifts across the week
steps.expectedResult: All 10+ shift assignments are visible with employee names, shift times, color-coded by shift type, no overlapping display issues

steps.action: Click on any assigned shift cell (e.g., Tuesday 2PM shift for 'Jane Doe')
steps.expectedResult: Shift details popup appears showing employee name, shift template name, start/end times, and 'Edit' and 'Remove' buttons

steps.action: Use the calendar navigation arrows to move to next week
steps.expectedResult: Calendar updates to show next week's dates, any assignments for that week are displayed, week header shows correct date range

postconditions: Calendar remains in weekly view mode until user changes view preference
All shift assignments are accurately displayed without data loss
User can navigate between weeks to view past and future schedules
Calendar view preference is saved in user session

functional.title: Verify administrator can make adjustments to existing shift assignments
preconditions: Administrator is logged in with schedule modification permissions
Employee 'Sarah Johnson' is already assigned to 'Evening Shift 4PM-12AM' on Wednesday, January 17, 2024
Employee 'Mike Davis' is available and not assigned to any shift on January 17, 2024
Schedule management page is open in calendar view

steps.action: Navigate to Wednesday, January 17, 2024 in the calendar and locate 'Sarah Johnson' in Evening Shift 4PM-12AM
steps.expectedResult: Shift assignment is visible showing 'Sarah Johnson' with shift time '4:00 PM - 12:00 AM'

steps.action: Click on the shift assignment cell for Sarah Johnson
steps.expectedResult: Shift details modal opens displaying employee name, shift details, and action buttons including 'Edit Assignment' and 'Remove Assignment'

steps.action: Click the 'Edit Assignment' button in the modal
steps.expectedResult: Edit mode activates showing dropdown to select different employee, current selection shows 'Sarah Johnson'

steps.action: From the employee dropdown, select 'Mike Davis' to replace Sarah Johnson
steps.expectedResult: Dropdown updates to show 'Mike Davis' selected, no validation errors appear, 'Save Changes' button becomes enabled

steps.action: Click the 'Save Changes' button in the edit modal
steps.expectedResult: Modal closes, calendar updates to show 'Mike Davis' in the Evening Shift slot, green confirmation message 'Assignment updated successfully' appears

steps.action: Verify Sarah Johnson is no longer assigned to this shift by checking her employee schedule
steps.expectedResult: Sarah Johnson's schedule for January 17 shows no assignments, she is marked as available

postconditions: Mike Davis is now assigned to Evening Shift 4PM-12AM on January 17, 2024 in database
Sarah Johnson's previous assignment is removed and she is available
Both employees receive notifications about the schedule change
Change is logged in audit trail with administrator name and timestamp

functional.title: Verify employees can view their assigned shifts in real-time
preconditions: Employee 'Tom Wilson' has valid login credentials and is logged into the system
Administrator has assigned Tom Wilson to 'Morning Shift 8AM-4PM' on Friday, January 19, 2024
Assignment was saved less than 5 seconds ago to test real-time update
Employee is on their personal dashboard page at /employee/dashboard

steps.action: As employee Tom Wilson, navigate to 'My Schedule' section by clicking the 'My Schedule' tab in the navigation menu
steps.expectedResult: Personal schedule page loads showing calendar view with employee's assigned shifts, loading completes within 2 seconds

steps.action: Locate Friday, January 19, 2024 in the calendar view
steps.expectedResult: Friday, January 19 is visible in the calendar, the newly assigned 'Morning Shift 8AM-4PM' is displayed with shift details

steps.action: Click on the assigned shift to view details
steps.expectedResult: Shift details popup opens showing shift name 'Morning Shift', time '8:00 AM - 4:00 PM', location, and any shift notes

steps.action: Without refreshing, have administrator assign another shift to Tom Wilson for Saturday, January 20, 2024, then wait 3 seconds
steps.expectedResult: Calendar automatically updates to show the new Saturday assignment without manual refresh, notification badge appears indicating new assignment

postconditions: Employee can view all current and future shift assignments
Real-time updates are reflected within 5 seconds of administrator changes
Employee remains logged in and on their schedule page
No administrator-only functions are visible to the employee

functional.title: Verify multiple employees can be assigned to the same shift template simultaneously
preconditions: Administrator is logged in with full schedule management permissions
Shift template 'Night Shift 12AM-8AM' exists and requires 4 staff members
At least 4 employees are available: 'Alice Brown', 'Bob Green', 'Carol White', 'David Black'
Schedule management page is open showing Thursday, January 18, 2024

steps.action: Select 'Night Shift 12AM-8AM' template from the shift templates dropdown for Thursday, January 18, 2024
steps.expectedResult: Shift template is selected, shift details show 'Required Staff: 4', empty shift slots are displayed

steps.action: Drag and drop 'Alice Brown' from the available employees list to the first slot in the Night Shift
steps.expectedResult: Alice Brown appears in slot 1, counter shows '1/4 staff assigned', no errors appear

steps.action: Drag and drop 'Bob Green', 'Carol White', and 'David Black' to slots 2, 3, and 4 respectively
steps.expectedResult: All 4 employees appear in their respective slots, counter shows '4/4 staff assigned', shift is marked as fully staffed with green indicator

steps.action: Click 'Save Schedule' button to save all 4 assignments
steps.expectedResult: Success message 'Schedule updated successfully - 4 employees assigned' appears, all assignments are saved and visible in calendar

postconditions: All 4 employees are assigned to Night Shift 12AM-8AM on January 18, 2024 in database
Shift is marked as fully staffed and no longer appears in understaffed reports
All 4 employees can view this assignment in their personal schedules
Shift template usage is tracked in analytics

functional.title: Verify schedule can be saved with partial shift assignments
preconditions: Administrator is logged in and on schedule management page
Shift template 'Afternoon Shift 12PM-8PM' requires 3 staff members
Only 2 employees are assigned to this shift for Monday, January 22, 2024
System allows saving of partially filled shifts

steps.action: Select 'Afternoon Shift 12PM-8PM' template for Monday, January 22, 2024
steps.expectedResult: Shift template loads showing 3 empty slots, required staff indicator shows '0/3'

steps.action: Assign 'Emma Taylor' and 'Frank Miller' to slots 1 and 2, leaving slot 3 empty
steps.expectedResult: Two employees are displayed in slots 1 and 2, slot 3 remains empty, counter shows '2/3 staff assigned', yellow warning indicator shows shift is understaffed

steps.action: Click 'Save Schedule' button
steps.expectedResult: Warning modal appears with message 'This shift is understaffed (2/3). Do you want to save anyway?' with 'Save Anyway' and 'Cancel' buttons

steps.action: Click 'Save Anyway' button in the warning modal
steps.expectedResult: Schedule is saved successfully, success message appears 'Schedule saved with 1 understaffed shift', shift is marked with yellow warning icon in calendar

postconditions: Partial assignment is saved in database with understaffed flag set to true
Shift appears in understaffed shifts report for administrator review
Both assigned employees can view their shifts normally
Administrator receives notification about understaffed shift

negative.title: Verify system prevents double-booking employee to overlapping shifts
preconditions: Administrator is logged in with schedule management permissions
Employee 'Jessica Martinez' is already assigned to 'Morning Shift 8AM-4PM' on Tuesday, January 16, 2024
Another shift 'Mid-Day Shift 12PM-8PM' exists for the same date with overlapping hours
Schedule management page is open in calendar view

steps.action: Navigate to Tuesday, January 16, 2024 and verify Jessica Martinez is assigned to Morning Shift 8AM-4PM
steps.expectedResult: Jessica Martinez's assignment to Morning Shift is visible in the calendar

steps.action: Select 'Mid-Day Shift 12PM-8PM' template for the same date (Tuesday, January 16, 2024)
steps.expectedResult: Mid-Day Shift template is selected, empty slots are displayed for assignment

steps.action: Attempt to drag and drop 'Jessica Martinez' from the employee list to the Mid-Day Shift slot
steps.expectedResult: Red error indicator appears on the shift slot, employee cannot be dropped, tooltip shows 'Employee already assigned to overlapping shift (8AM-4PM)'

steps.action: Attempt to force assignment by clicking the shift slot and selecting Jessica Martinez from the dropdown
steps.expectedResult: Jessica Martinez appears in dropdown but is disabled/grayed out with warning icon, hover text shows 'Conflict: Already assigned 8AM-4PM'

steps.action: Try to click 'Save Schedule' button if assignment was somehow forced
steps.expectedResult: Validation error modal appears with message 'Cannot save schedule: Jessica Martinez has overlapping shifts on 01/16/2024', Save button is disabled

postconditions: No double-booking is saved in the EmployeeSchedules table
Jessica Martinez remains assigned only to the original Morning Shift 8AM-4PM
Error is logged in system logs with details of attempted double-booking
Administrator remains on schedule management page to correct the conflict

negative.title: Verify unauthorized user cannot access schedule management functionality
preconditions: User 'RegularEmployee123' is logged in with standard Employee role (not Administrator)
User does not have schedule management permissions in the system
User is currently on their personal dashboard at /employee/dashboard
Schedule management page URL is /admin/schedules

steps.action: Attempt to navigate directly to /admin/schedules by typing URL in browser address bar
steps.expectedResult: Access is denied, user is redirected to /unauthorized page with error message 'You do not have permission to access this page'

steps.action: Check main navigation menu for schedule management options
steps.expectedResult: No 'Schedule Management' or 'Admin' menu items are visible, only employee-level menu options are shown

steps.action: Attempt to make a POST request to /api/employee-schedules endpoint using browser developer tools with valid shift assignment data
steps.expectedResult: API returns 403 Forbidden status code with JSON response {'error': 'Insufficient permissions', 'required_role': 'Administrator'}

steps.action: Try to access schedule management via any bookmarked links or cached pages
steps.expectedResult: All attempts result in authorization error, session validation prevents access, user is redirected to appropriate error page

postconditions: No unauthorized schedule modifications are made in the database
Security event is logged showing unauthorized access attempt with user ID and timestamp
User remains logged in but confined to employee-level permissions
No sensitive administrator data is exposed to the unauthorized user

negative.title: Verify system handles assignment to non-existent shift template gracefully
preconditions: Administrator is logged in on schedule management page
Shift template with ID 'SHIFT-999' does not exist in the database
At least one valid employee 'Kevin Lee' exists in the system
Browser developer console is open to monitor errors

steps.action: Using browser developer tools, attempt to manipulate the shift template dropdown to select non-existent template ID 'SHIFT-999'
steps.expectedResult: System detects invalid template ID, error message appears 'Invalid shift template selected', dropdown resets to default state

steps.action: Attempt to make a direct API call to POST /api/employee-schedules with payload containing non-existent shiftTemplateId: 'SHIFT-999'
steps.expectedResult: API returns 404 Not Found status with error message {'error': 'Shift template not found', 'templateId': 'SHIFT-999'}

steps.action: Check if any partial data was saved in the database
steps.expectedResult: No records are created in EmployeeSchedules table, database integrity is maintained

postconditions: No invalid schedule assignments exist in the database
Error is logged in application error logs with details of invalid template ID
User interface remains stable without crashes or freezing
Administrator can continue working with valid shift templates

negative.title: Verify system handles network timeout during schedule save operation
preconditions: Administrator is logged in and has made valid shift assignments for 5 employees
Network throttling is enabled in browser developer tools to simulate slow connection
API timeout is set to 30 seconds in system configuration
Schedule is ready to be saved with all valid data

steps.action: Set network throttling to 'Offline' mode in browser developer tools after clicking 'Save Schedule' button but before request completes
steps.expectedResult: Loading spinner appears, after 30 seconds timeout error message displays 'Unable to save schedule. Please check your connection and try again.'

steps.action: Check the calendar view to see if any assignments were partially saved
steps.expectedResult: Calendar shows previous state before save attempt, no partial data is displayed, unsaved changes indicator remains active

steps.action: Restore network connection and click 'Save Schedule' button again
steps.expectedResult: Save operation completes successfully, all 5 assignments are saved, success message appears

steps.action: Verify database for duplicate entries from the failed attempt
steps.expectedResult: No duplicate records exist, only one set of assignments is saved with correct timestamp

postconditions: No corrupted or partial data exists in EmployeeSchedules table
User's unsaved work is preserved in the UI for retry
Network error is logged with timestamp and user context
System remains in consistent state ready for retry

negative.title: Verify system prevents assignment of inactive or terminated employees
preconditions: Administrator is logged in on schedule management page
Employee 'Linda Chen' has status 'Terminated' with termination date of January 10, 2024
Employee 'Mark Johnson' has status 'Inactive' (on leave)
Attempting to assign shifts for January 20, 2024 (after termination date)

steps.action: Open the available employees list panel on the schedule management page
steps.expectedResult: Employee list displays only active employees, 'Linda Chen' and 'Mark Johnson' are not visible in the available employees list

steps.action: Use the employee search box to search for 'Linda Chen'
steps.expectedResult: Search returns no results or shows 'Linda Chen' with 'Terminated' badge and disabled state, cannot be selected

steps.action: Attempt to make direct API call to POST /api/employee-schedules with employeeId for Linda Chen
steps.expectedResult: API returns 400 Bad Request with error message {'error': 'Cannot assign terminated employee', 'employeeId': 'LINDA_CHEN_ID', 'status': 'Terminated'}

steps.action: Attempt the same process for inactive employee 'Mark Johnson'
steps.expectedResult: Similar validation error appears: 'Cannot assign inactive employee to shift', assignment is blocked

postconditions: No assignments exist for terminated or inactive employees in the database
Validation error is logged in audit trail
Administrator is prompted to select only active employees
Employee status integrity is maintained in the system

negative.title: Verify system handles concurrent schedule modifications by multiple administrators
preconditions: Two administrators 'Admin1' and 'Admin2' are logged in simultaneously on different browsers/sessions
Both are viewing the same shift on Wednesday, January 24, 2024 - Morning Shift 8AM-4PM
Shift currently has 'Nancy White' assigned
Both administrators attempt to modify the same shift assignment

steps.action: Admin1 clicks on Nancy White's assignment and selects 'Edit Assignment' to change to 'Oliver Brown'
steps.expectedResult: Edit modal opens for Admin1 showing current assignment and employee dropdown

steps.action: Before Admin1 saves, Admin2 also clicks on the same assignment and selects 'Edit Assignment' to change to 'Patricia Green'
steps.expectedResult: Edit modal opens for Admin2 showing current assignment

steps.action: Admin1 clicks 'Save Changes' first, successfully updating assignment to Oliver Brown
steps.expectedResult: Admin1 sees success message, calendar updates to show Oliver Brown

steps.action: Admin2 clicks 'Save Changes' immediately after
steps.expectedResult: Conflict error appears: 'This assignment was modified by another user. Please refresh and try again.' Save is blocked, Admin2's changes are not applied

steps.action: Admin2 refreshes the page and views the shift
steps.expectedResult: Calendar shows Oliver Brown (Admin1's change), Admin2 can now make a new edit if needed

postconditions: Only Admin1's change is saved in database (Oliver Brown is assigned)
No data corruption or conflicting assignments exist
Both administrators' actions are logged in audit trail with timestamps
Optimistic locking or version control prevents data conflicts

edgeCases.title: Verify system handles maximum capacity of 500 employee assignments without performance degradation
preconditions: Administrator is logged in with schedule management permissions
Database contains exactly 500 active employees
System performance baseline is established (page load < 3 seconds)
Schedule management page is open with empty schedule for current month

steps.action: Use bulk assignment feature or API to assign all 500 employees to various shifts across the current month
steps.expectedResult: Bulk assignment completes within 10 seconds, progress indicator shows completion status, no timeout errors occur

steps.action: Navigate to the calendar view showing the month with 500 assignments
steps.expectedResult: Calendar loads within 3 seconds, all 500 assignments are visible, scrolling is smooth without lag, no browser freezing occurs

steps.action: Use calendar filters to view assignments by specific shift type or date range
steps.expectedResult: Filtering completes within 2 seconds, correct subset of assignments is displayed, filter controls remain responsive

steps.action: Attempt to modify one assignment among the 500 and save the change
steps.expectedResult: Edit and save operations complete within 3 seconds, only the modified assignment is updated, no impact on other 499 assignments

steps.action: Export the schedule with all 500 assignments to PDF or Excel format
steps.expectedResult: Export completes within 15 seconds, file contains all 500 assignments accurately formatted, file size is reasonable (< 5MB)

postconditions: All 500 employee assignments are accurately stored in database
System performance remains within acceptable thresholds (< 3 second page loads)
No memory leaks or browser crashes occur
Database query performance is optimized with proper indexing

edgeCases.title: Verify schedule management with employee names containing special characters and Unicode
preconditions: Administrator is logged in on schedule management page
Employees exist with names: 'José María Ñoño', 'Müller-Schmidt', 'O'Brien', '李明 (Li Ming)', 'Владимир'
Shift template 'Morning Shift 8AM-4PM' is available for assignment
Database supports UTF-8 character encoding

steps.action: Search for employee 'José María Ñoño' using the employee search box
steps.expectedResult: Employee is found and displayed correctly with all special characters (é, í, Ñ, ñ) rendered properly

steps.action: Assign 'José María Ñoño' to Morning Shift on Monday, January 29, 2024
steps.expectedResult: Assignment is successful, name displays correctly in calendar with all accented characters, no character encoding errors

steps.action: Assign employees 'Müller-Schmidt', 'O'Brien', '李明 (Li Ming)', and 'Владимир' to different shifts on the same day
steps.expectedResult: All names are displayed correctly in calendar: umlaut (ü), hyphen, apostrophe, Chinese characters, and Cyrillic characters render properly

steps.action: Save the schedule and refresh the page
steps.expectedResult: All special character names persist correctly after save and reload, no character corruption or replacement with question marks

steps.action: Export schedule to PDF and verify special characters in the exported document
steps.expectedResult: PDF export contains all names with special characters rendered correctly, fonts support all Unicode characters used

postconditions: All employee names with special characters are stored correctly in database with UTF-8 encoding
Calendar display supports international character sets without corruption
Export functionality preserves special characters in all formats
No data loss or character replacement occurs in any operation

edgeCases.title: Verify schedule management at exact midnight boundary between days
preconditions: Administrator is logged in on schedule management page
Shift template 'Night Shift 8PM-4AM' exists that spans across midnight (crosses day boundary)
Employee 'Rachel Adams' is available for assignment
System time zone is set to EST (UTC-5)

steps.action: Select 'Night Shift 8PM-4AM' template for Thursday, January 25, 2024 (shift starts Thursday 8PM, ends Friday 4AM)
steps.expectedResult: Shift template loads correctly, system recognizes shift spans two calendar days, visual indicator shows shift extends to next day

steps.action: Assign 'Rachel Adams' to this overnight shift
steps.expectedResult: Assignment is successful, calendar shows shift starting on Thursday with visual continuation to Friday, no double-booking validation errors

steps.action: Attempt to assign Rachel Adams to another shift on Friday, January 26 at 2AM (during her overnight shift)
steps.expectedResult: Validation error appears: 'Employee already assigned to overlapping shift (8PM Thu - 4AM Fri)', assignment is blocked

steps.action: View Rachel's personal schedule as the employee
steps.expectedResult: Overnight shift displays correctly showing start date Thursday and end date Friday, time zone is clearly indicated, no confusion about which day the shift belongs to

steps.action: Generate a report for shifts on Friday, January 26, 2024
steps.expectedResult: Rachel's overnight shift appears in Friday's report since it extends into Friday, report clearly shows shift started previous day

postconditions: Overnight shift is correctly stored with proper start and end timestamps in database
Double-booking validation correctly handles shifts spanning midnight
Calendar visualization clearly indicates multi-day shifts
Time zone handling is consistent across all views and reports

edgeCases.title: Verify schedule management with zero available employees for assignment
preconditions: Administrator is logged in on schedule management page
All employees in the system are either terminated, inactive, or already assigned to shifts during the target time period
Shift template 'Afternoon Shift 12PM-8PM' exists for Tuesday, January 30, 2024
No available employees exist for this date/time

steps.action: Navigate to Tuesday, January 30, 2024 and select 'Afternoon Shift 12PM-8PM' template
steps.expectedResult: Shift template loads, available employees panel displays message 'No available employees for this shift time' or shows empty list

steps.action: Attempt to drag and drop from the empty employee list
steps.expectedResult: No drag action is possible, helpful message appears: 'All employees are currently assigned or unavailable. Please adjust existing assignments or add new employees.'

steps.action: Click on the shift slot to manually select an employee
steps.expectedResult: Employee dropdown is empty or disabled, tooltip explains 'No employees available for assignment during this time period'

steps.action: Check if system provides suggestions or alternatives
steps.expectedResult: System displays helpful options: 'View conflicting assignments', 'Adjust shift time', or 'Request additional staff', administrator can take corrective action

postconditions: No invalid or forced assignments are created in the database
Administrator is clearly informed about the unavailability issue
System provides actionable next steps to resolve staffing shortage
Shift remains unfilled and flagged for administrator attention

edgeCases.title: Verify schedule management during daylight saving time transition
preconditions: Administrator is logged in on schedule management page
System date is set to March 10, 2024 (DST begins at 2:00 AM, clocks spring forward to 3:00 AM)
Shift template 'Overnight Shift 12AM-8AM' exists that spans the DST transition
Employee 'Steven Parker' is available for assignment
System time zone is set to EST/EDT

steps.action: Assign 'Steven Parker' to 'Overnight Shift 12AM-8AM' on Sunday, March 10, 2024 (DST transition day)
steps.expectedResult: Assignment is successful, system displays warning: 'Note: This shift occurs during DST transition. Actual duration will be 7 hours instead of 8 hours.'

steps.action: View the shift details and verify time calculations
steps.expectedResult: Shift shows start time 12:00 AM, end time 8:00 AM, but duration is calculated as 7 hours due to DST, compensation or adjustment note is visible

steps.action: Save the schedule and verify in employee's view
steps.expectedResult: Employee sees the shift with DST notification, time zone indicator shows EDT after 3:00 AM, no confusion about actual working hours

steps.action: Generate payroll report for this shift
steps.expectedResult: Report correctly calculates 7 actual working hours, DST adjustment is noted, employee is compensated correctly

postconditions: Shift is stored with correct timestamps accounting for DST transition
Duration calculations are accurate (7 hours instead of 8)
All stakeholders are notified about DST impact on shift duration
Payroll and time tracking systems receive correct duration data

edgeCases.title: Verify rapid consecutive save operations do not create duplicate assignments
preconditions: Administrator is logged in on schedule management page
Employee 'Tina Rodriguez' is assigned to 'Morning Shift 8AM-4PM' on February 1, 2024
Network latency is normal (no throttling)
Save button is enabled and functional

steps.action: Make a valid assignment change (assign Tina Rodriguez to the shift)
steps.expectedResult: Assignment is displayed in the calendar, Save button is enabled

steps.action: Click the 'Save Schedule' button rapidly 5 times in succession (within 1 second)
steps.expectedResult: Save button becomes disabled after first click, loading spinner appears, subsequent clicks are ignored or queued

steps.action: Wait for save operation to complete and check the calendar
steps.expectedResult: Success message appears only once: 'Schedule updated successfully', assignment appears only once in calendar, no duplicate entries

steps.action: Query the database directly to check for duplicate records
steps.expectedResult: Only one record exists for Tina Rodriguez's assignment on February 1, 2024, no duplicate entries with same timestamp or employee ID

steps.action: Check API logs for multiple POST requests
steps.expectedResult: Either only one POST request was sent (client-side prevention), or multiple requests were sent but server-side idempotency prevented duplicates

postconditions: Exactly one assignment record exists in EmployeeSchedules table
No duplicate data or orphaned records are created
Save button re-enables after operation completes
System implements proper request debouncing or idempotency

accessibility.title: Verify complete keyboard navigation through schedule management interface
preconditions: Administrator is logged in on schedule management page
Screen reader is turned off for this test (pure keyboard navigation)
At least one shift template and 3 employees are available in the system
Browser is set to default zoom level (100%)

steps.action: Press Tab key from the page header to navigate through all interactive elements
steps.expectedResult: Focus moves sequentially through: main navigation, shift template dropdown, calendar navigation buttons, date cells, employee list, Save button. Focus indicator is clearly visible (2px solid border) on each element.

steps.action: Use Tab to reach the shift template dropdown, press Enter to open it, use Arrow keys to select a template, press Enter to confirm
steps.expectedResult: Dropdown opens on Enter, Arrow Up/Down navigate options, selected option is highlighted, Enter confirms selection and closes dropdown, focus returns to dropdown trigger

steps.action: Tab to the calendar, use Arrow keys to navigate between date cells
steps.expectedResult: Arrow keys move focus between calendar dates (Left/Right for days, Up/Down for weeks), current focused date has visible focus ring, Enter key selects the date

steps.action: Tab to employee list, use Arrow keys to select an employee, press Space or Enter to select for assignment
steps.expectedResult: Arrow keys navigate employee list, selected employee is highlighted, Space/Enter marks employee for assignment, visual feedback confirms selection

steps.action: Press Tab to reach 'Save Schedule' button, press Enter to save
steps.expectedResult: Save button receives focus with visible indicator, Enter key triggers save operation, success message appears and receives focus for screen reader announcement

steps.action: Press Shift+Tab to navigate backwards through all elements
steps.expectedResult: Focus moves in reverse order through all interactive elements, no focus traps occur, user can navigate back to page header

steps.action: Press Escape key when a modal or dropdown is open
steps.expectedResult: Escape key closes modal/dropdown, focus returns to the trigger element that opened it, no keyboard trap occurs

postconditions: All interactive elements are reachable via keyboard alone
Focus order is logical and follows visual layout
No keyboard traps exist in the interface
Focus indicators meet WCAG 2.1 contrast requirements (3:1 minimum)

accessibility.title: Verify screen reader announces all schedule management actions and states
preconditions: Administrator is logged in on schedule management page
NVDA or JAWS screen reader is active and running
At least one shift template exists and one employee is available
Page has loaded completely with all ARIA labels in place

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule management page and listen to screen reader announcement
steps.expectedResult: Screen reader announces: 'Employee Schedule Management, main region. Heading level 1: Schedule Management. You are currently in the schedule calendar view.'

steps.action: Tab to the shift template dropdown and activate it
steps.expectedResult: Screen reader announces: 'Shift template, combo box, collapsed. Press Enter to expand.' When opened: 'Shift template, combo box, expanded. 5 options available. Morning Shift 8AM-4PM, 1 of 5.'

steps.action: Select a shift template and navigate to a calendar date
steps.expectedResult: Screen reader announces: 'Morning Shift 8AM-4PM selected.' Then: 'Calendar grid, January 2024. Monday, January 15, 2024, button, no assignments.'

steps.action: Assign an employee to a shift
steps.expectedResult: Screen reader announces: 'John Smith assigned to Morning Shift, Monday January 15, 8:00 AM to 4:00 PM. Shift has 1 of 3 required staff.'

steps.action: Attempt to assign an employee to an overlapping shift (validation error)
steps.expectedResult: Screen reader announces: 'Error: Cannot assign John Smith. Employee already assigned to overlapping shift from 8:00 AM to 4:00 PM. Alert.' Focus moves to error message.

steps.action: Save the schedule successfully
steps.expectedResult: Screen reader announces: 'Schedule updated successfully. 1 employee assigned. Status message.' ARIA live region updates are announced without moving focus.

steps.action: Navigate through assigned shifts in the calendar
steps.expectedResult: Screen reader announces each shift with full details: 'Monday January 15, Morning Shift 8AM-4PM, assigned: John Smith, 1 of 3 staff, button.'

postconditions: All interactive elements have proper ARIA labels and roles
State changes are announced via ARIA live regions (aria-live='polite' for updates, 'assertive' for errors)
Error messages are associated with form fields via aria-describedby
Dynamic content updates are announced without moving focus

accessibility.title: Verify focus management in modals and dialogs
preconditions: Administrator is logged in on schedule management page
At least one shift assignment exists that can be edited
Keyboard navigation is being used (no mouse)
Screen reader may be active for verification

steps.action: Use keyboard to navigate to an existing shift assignment and press Enter to open edit modal
steps.expectedResult: Modal opens, focus automatically moves to the first interactive element in modal (close button or first form field), modal has role='dialog' and aria-modal='true'

steps.action: Press Tab to navigate through all elements within the modal
steps.expectedResult: Focus cycles only within modal elements: close button, employee dropdown, save button, cancel button. Focus does not escape to background page content.

steps.action: Press Shift+Tab from the first element in the modal
steps.expectedResult: Focus moves to the last interactive element in the modal (Cancel or Save button), creating a focus loop within the modal

steps.action: Press Escape key while modal is open
steps.expectedResult: Modal closes, focus returns to the trigger element (the shift assignment that was clicked), screen reader announces 'Dialog closed'

steps.action: Open modal again, click 'Cancel' button using keyboard (Enter or Space)
steps.expectedResult: Modal closes, focus returns to original trigger element, no data is saved

steps.action: Open modal again, make changes, and click 'Save' button using keyboard
steps.expectedResult: Modal closes after save, focus returns to updated shift assignment, screen reader announces 'Assignment updated successfully'

steps.action: Verify background content is not accessible while modal is open
steps.expectedResult: Background content has aria-hidden='true' or inert attribute, screen reader cannot access background elements, keyboard focus is trapped in modal

userStoryObject.description:
CONTEXT & BACKGROUND:
Managing employee schedules effectively is crucial for ensuring that all shifts are covered and that employee availability is respected. This feature allows administrators to assign employees to shifts based on the created templates.

CURRENT STATE:
Currently, shifts are assigned manually, leading to potential conflicts and inefficiencies.

DESIRED STATE:
Administrators can easily assign employees to shifts and view schedules in a user-friendly format.

KEY FUNCTIONALITY:
• Assign employees to shifts using templates.
• View schedules in a calendar format.
• Make adjustments to assignments as needed.
• Employees can view their shifts in real-time.

USER INTERACTION FLOW:
1. Administrator navigates to the employee schedule management page.
2. Administrator selects a shift template.
3. Administrator assigns employees to the selected shift.
4. Administrator saves the schedule.
5. System confirms the schedule update.
6. Employees can view their assigned shifts.

TECHNICAL CONSIDERATIONS:
• Data source: EmployeeSchedules table in the database.
• Validation rules: Ensure employees are not double-booked.
• API endpoints: POST /api/employee-schedules for assignments.
• Security: Only authorized administrators can manage schedules.
• Performance: System should handle up to 500 employee assignments without performance issues.

OUT OF SCOPE:
• Employee self-service scheduling is not included in this story.

SUCCESS METRICS:
• 95% of shifts are filled without conflicts.
acceptanceCriteria: System allows assignment of employees to shifts using templates.
System displays schedules in a calendar format for easy viewing.
Administrators can make adjustments to assignments without errors.
Employees can view their assigned shifts in real-time.
